div.pre: 175 Eretria, Euboea, 1937 (468) Burial: c. 235 B.C. (Wallace) Contents: 572+ AR Philip II: 1 tetradr. Alexander III: 24+ dr. Demetrius Poliorcetes: 1 tetradr.; 1 dr.; 3 triob. Antigonus Gonatas: 15 tetradr. Lysimachus: 18 tetradr.; 2 dr. Locri Opuntii: 2+ st.; 18+ triob. Phocis: 1+ triob. Boeotia: 6+ st. (1 Tanagra); 5 dr.; 5+ triob. Carystus: 1 dr. Chalcis: 1+ dr. Euboean League: 6 didr.; 7 tetradr.; 275 dr. Histiaea: 1+ tetrob. Athens: 31+ tetradr. Paros: 1 tetradr. (ΑΝΑΞΙΚ) Attalid: 2 tetradr. Rhodes: 7+ didr.; dr. Seleucid: 2+ tetradr. Ptolemy I-III: 136+ tetradr. Disposition: Athens 476 Varoucha, Epitymbion Christen Tsounta (Athens, 1941), pp. 670-2 Wallace, NNM 134 (1956), pp. 47-9, no. 1 Merker, ANSMN 9 (1960), pp. 43-4 Several lots are recorded by Wallace. Additional lots were reported by W. Schwabacher as on the market in 1937 and early 1938; one of these is Noe 468 and another includes the Paros tetradr. and several Seleucid pieces, one said to be Antiochus III but that is perhaps an error for An- tiochus II. The Ptolemaic issues, crucial for the burial date, comprise coins of Ptolemies I and II according to Varoucha and Merker. Wallace includes Ptolemy III and his photo- graphic record of a major part of the hd. (on file in the ANS) shows a tetradr. of the third Ptolemy (Svoronos 1001) in splendid condition
